New Records: Sacramento Kings trailed by 14 in the first half but tied the game at halftime
De'Aaron Fox assisted on a 3-pointer by Keon Ellis
Paul George had 30 points, eight rebounds, and five assists for the 76ers
Tyrese Maxey added 27 points, six assists, and four steals
Tyrese Maxey made three 3-pointers, setting a franchise record
Key Match Events: Sacramento Kings closed the game with a 15-0 run
De'Aaron Fox started the surge with a short floater and assisted on a 3-pointer by Keon Ellis
A goaltending call against the 76ers on Malik Monk's driving layup gave the Kings the lead
Paul George lost the ball and fouled Monk, who hit two free throws to make it 111-107 with 7.1 seconds left
Pre-Game Insights: Sacramento Kings were under interim coach Doug Christie after Mike Brown was fired last week
Philadelphia 76ers had won four in a row
Sacramento trailed by 14 in the first half
Philadelphia led 107-98 with 3:15 remaining before the Kings took over
Joel Embiid and Kelly Oubre Jr. did not play for the Sixers
Keegan Murray was sidelined for the Kings with left ankle soreness
Post-Match Reflections: Sacramento held the 76ers scoreless for the final 3:30
Miscellaneous Highlights: Key moment: Maxey connected on his third 3-pointer with 6:52 left
Key stat: Sabonis pulled down nine of Sacramento's 14 offensive rebounds
